page.title: 07HOME LIFE ASHBY MAGNA
page.content: Home life is based on nuclear families and there is a mixture of new families from outside the area and long established families. School children are bussed to Gilmorton junior school and senior children to Lutterworth. Different types of energy are used i.e. oil, electricity, coal and wood. There is no gas in the area. Most households have pets such as cats, dogs and horses, some of which are used as working animals such as dogs for shepherding and shooting; horses are used for hunting as the Atherstone and Fernie Hunts pass through and occasionally meet here. Shopping is done in nearby towns and cities. The residents are keen gardeners and produce a lot of home grown fruit and vegetables for home consumption.
